abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan would increase
            electricity generating capacity by helping finance
            construction of two 220 MW units at the Hwange Thermal Power
            Station and a transmission line. In addition, the loan would
            finance engineering consulting services, electricity tariff
            structure and energy pricing study. The project would enable
            Zimbabwe to meet the power demand up to the end of 1986.
